Set-up Instructions¶

Instructions for setting installing CFL and its dependencies can be found `here`_ - A quick start guide with example code can be found here - Complete documentation can be found here on Read the Docs.

Running CFL¶

Go to the `examples`_ folder to find Jupyter Notebooks that demonstrate how to use the CFL code. Check out the [Quick Start Guide](https://github.com/eberharf/cfl/blob/master/examples/quick_start_guide.ipynb first if you’re just getting started.

CFL is released under a BSD-like license for non-commercial use only. If you use CFL in published research work, we encourage you to cite this repository:

Causal Feature Learning (2021).
https://github.com/eberharf/cfl

or use the BibTex reference:

@misc{cfl2021,
title = "Causal Feature Learning",
year = "2021",
publisher = "GitHub",
url = "https://github.com/eberharf/cfl"}

  • Jenna Kahn & Iman Wahle [first authors; name order chosen randomly]

  • Krzysztof Chalupka

  • Patrick Burauel

  • Pietro Perona

  • Frederick Eberhardt

Jenna Kahn and Iman Wahle designed the software and wrote the code in this repository.

Krzysztof Chalupka, Pietro Perona and Frederick Eberhardt developed the original theory for CFL. Krzysztof also wrote the original code upon which this software is based.

Code development benefitted from regular discussions with Patrick Burauel.
